actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-912, by Mr. Moakley.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 199.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
VOTE POSTPONED - The yeas and nays were ordered on passage of the resolution. The Chair announced that the vote would be postponed until no earlier than Noon today.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 168 (Roll no. 502).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving the requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI against consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives, with respect to certain budget and appropriations resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules on or before October 24, 1990, provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from such committee on the same day it is presented to the House. Waives the provisions for the consideration or disposition of: (1) a reconciliation bill for FY 1991 (including an amendment or conference report); (2) a joint resolution making continuing appropriations for FY 1991 (including an amendment or conference report); or (3) a bill to extend the temporary increase in the public debt limit (including an amendment or conference report); and (4) a conference report (including amendments reported from conference in disagreement) on any general appropriation bill. Makes it in order at any time through such date, to consider conference reports on any general appropriation bill on the same day reported or any day thereafter if copies, together with the text of any amendment reported, have been available to Members for at least two hours before the beginning of such consideration.

titles.title: Waiving the requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI against consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and for other purposes.
